message.content:
cs.CL, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.CV, cs.IR. 

The paper deals with text classification using deep learning techniques, specifically convolutional neural networks (CNNs) and recurrent neural networks (RNNs). Therefore, the most likely sub-category is cs.CL (Computation and Language), which deals with natural language processing and computational linguistics. 

The paper also discusses the challenges faced by CNNs in text processing, which suggests that it could belong to the sub-category cs.CV (Computer Vision and Pattern Recognition), which deals with image and video processing. 

The use of deep learning techniques also suggests that it could belong to the sub-category cs.LG (Machine Learning), which deals with the development of algorithms that can learn from data. 

The paper proposes a new model that combines both CNNs and RNNs, which suggests that it could belong to the sub-category cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence), which deals with the development of intelligent agents that can learn and reason. 

Finally, the paper evaluates its proposed model on different text classification datasets, which suggests that it could belong to the sub-category cs.IR (Information Retrieval), which deals with the retrieval of relevant information from large collections of data.
